Sketches after LeWitt

I model many sketches after the work of Sol LeWitt. This also served as a set of exercises to learn and develop p5js skills. I love his work, and will return to this stuff.

Sketches

  • Here is LeWitt 11
    • Here is LeWitt 11 with randomness and color. This particular sketch is glorious.
    • Here is Lewitt 11 with extra randomness and some extra color. The sensation of depth and complexity is deep.
  • Here is LeWitt 16, a classic formed from 3 sets of lines.
  • Here is LeWitt 17. Four squares, each with a fundamental line direction.
    • This is LeWitt 17, but with a little twist. After staring at many LeWitts for a day, it's like a practical joke.
  • Here is LeWitt 46. A canvas with many non-intersecting scribbles.
  • Here is LeWitt 46, but where the scribbles slowly move. I find it actually quite unsettling to look closely at.
  • Here is LeWitt 47. The four classic patterns, without repeating the same pattern twice, slowly getting thicker.
  • Here is LeWitt 86. Many random lines on a canvas.

Ideas

  • Sketch 11 (and especially the random one with color) is super great for experimentation. It looks great and should be adapted to all sorts of things. It might be interesting to set the randomness to noise and to somehow have an infinite pan from the noise.
  • Sketch 16 is sort of like a set of Moire patterns. Different arrangements and different widths would be interesting. It would also be interesting to animate Sketch 16. (Do This)
